snippet: The reaction to the new production of “Tannhäuser” in Düsseldorf on opening night led management to announce it would now be performed as a concert, with little in the way of staging or costumes.
abstract: Controversy erupts in Dusseldorf, Germany, over Deutsche Oper am Rhein production of Richard Wagner's opera Tannhauser, which receives cascade of boos and complaints because of violent depictions of Nazi concentration camp in its staging; company management quickly decides that opera will instead be performed in concert, with singing and music but little in way of staging or costumes.
lead_paragraph: The reaction to the new production of “Tannhäuser” in Düsseldorf on opening night led management to announce it would now be performed as a concert, with little in the way of staging or costumes.

headline.seo: Uproar in Germany Over Nazi Scenes in Wagner’s ‘Tannhäuser’
headline.main: Germans Boo Nazi Scenes in an Opera by Wagner
headline.print_headline: Germans Boo Nazi Scenes In Production Of Wagner
